definitions: The net pressure gradient causing blood flow to the brain (cerebral perfusion). It is calculated as the difference between the mean arterial pressure (MAP) and the intracranial pressure (ICP), or the central venous pressure (CVP) if it is higher than ICP.
examples: Maintaining adequate cerebral perfusion pressure is crucial after a traumatic brain injury.
A CPP below 60 mmHg can lead to cerebral ischemia.
Nurses closely monitor CPP in neurocritical care units.
